results.t: OBNOXIOUS definition in American English - Collins Dictionary

results.p: The meaning of OBNOXIOUS is odiously or disgustingly objectionable : highly offensive. How to use obnoxious in a sentence.

results.t: OBNOXIOUS | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: Sep 4, 2024 — very unpleasant or rude: Some of his colleagues say that he's loud and obnoxious. When she's in a bad mood she's obnoxious to everyone.
adjective · highly objectionable or offensive; odious: · annoying or objectionable due to being a show-off or attracting undue attention to oneself: · Archaic.
If something is obnoxious, it's annoying and unpleasant. Generally, people like to avoid obnoxious folks.

results.t: OBNOXIOUS definition and meaning | Collins English ...
results.p: If you describe someone as obnoxious, you think that they are very unpleasant. He was a most obnoxious man. No-one liked him.
unpleasant in a way that makes people feel offended, annoyed, or disgusted. He said some really obnoxious things about his ex-girlfriend at the party.

results.t: OBNOXIOUS Synonyms: 194 Similar and Opposite Words
results.p: 5 days ago — 1. as in ugly causing intense displeasure, disgust, or resentment the obnoxious disc jockey caused many listeners to call the station with complaints.
​extremely unpleasant, especially in a way that offends people synonym offensive. obnoxious behaviour; a thoroughly obnoxious little man; obnoxious odours ...

results.t: OBNOXIOUSLY | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: Sep 4, 2024 — in a very unpleasant or rude way: obnoxiously arrogant/drunk She obnoxiously corrected everything I said.

results.t: Am I using the word "obnoxious" correctly? : r/language
results.p: Obnoxious means loud, inconsiderate and offensive. Generally it describes behavior rather than people.
